title: MLB Extends Deadline, Keeping Opening-Day Hopes Alive
sub_head: Owners and locked-out players pause negotiations, will convene for a ninth consecutive day later Tuesday morning
body:
JUPITER, Fla.—The deadline wasn’t a deadline after all.
Major League Baseball owners and locked-out players failed to reach a new labor contract after a 16 1/2-hour day of bargaining that lasted until 2:30 a.m. Tuesday. But the parties made enough progress toward a deal for management to backtrack on its threat to cancel games if a new collective-bargaining agreement wasn’t in place by the end of Monday.
